trans-unit.source: Like Python's datetime.datetime, Matplotlib uses the Gregorian calendar for all conversions between dates and floating point numbers. This practice is not universal, and calendar differences can cause confusing differences between what Python and Matplotlib give as the number of days since 0001-01-01 and what other software and databases yield. For example, the US Naval Observatory uses a calendar that switches from Julian to Gregorian in October, 1582. Hence, using their calculator, the number of days between 0001-01-01 and 2006-04-01 is 732403, whereas using the Gregorian calendar via the datetime module we find:

Like Python's datetime, mpl uses the Gregorian calendar for all conversions between dates and floating point numbers. This practice is not universal, and calendar differences can cause confusing differences between what Python and mpl give as the number of days since 0001-01-01 and what other software and databases yield. For example, the US Naval Observatory uses a calendar that switches from Julian to Gregorian in October, 1582. Hence, using their calculator, the number of days between 0001-01-01 and 2006-04-01 is 732403, whereas using the Gregorian calendar via the datetime module we find:
trans-unit.target: Como la fecha y hora de Python,mpl usa el calendario gregoriano para todas las conversiones entre fechas y números de punto flotante.Esta práctica no es universal,y las diferencias de calendario pueden causar diferencias confusas entre lo que Python y mpl dan como número de días desde 0001-01-01 y lo que dan otros programas y bases de datos.Por ejemplo,el Observatorio Naval de los EE.UU.utiliza un calendario que cambia de Juliano a Gregoriano en octubre de 1582.Por lo tanto,usando su calculadora,el número de días entre el 0001-01-01 y el 2006-04-01 es 732403,mientras que usando el calendario gregoriano a través del módulo de fecha y hora que encontramos:

Limits may be passed in reverse order to flip the direction of the x-axis. For example, suppose x represents the number of years before present. The x-axis limits might be set like the following so 5000 years ago is on the left of the plot and the present is on the right.

Mapping data onto colors using a colormap typically involves two steps: a data array is first mapped onto the range 0-1 using a subclass of Normalize, then this number is mapped to a color using a subclass of Colormap. Two are provided here: LinearSegmentedColormap, which uses piecewise-linear interpolation to define colormaps, and ListedColormap, which makes a colormap from a list of colors.
trans-unit.target: El mapeo de datos en colores usando un mapa de colores generalmente implica dos pasos: primero se asigna una matriz de datos al rango 0-1 usando una subclase de Normalize , luego este número se asigna a un color usando una subclase de Colormap de colores . Aquí se proporcionan dos: LinearSegmentedColormap , que utiliza la interpolación lineal por partes para definir ListedColormap de colores , y ListedColormap , que crea un mapa de colores a partir de una lista de colores.

trans-unit.source: Mapping data onto colors using a colormap typically involves two steps: a data array is first mapped onto the range 0-1 using a subclass of Normalize, then this number is mapped to a color using a subclass of Colormap. Two sublasses of Colormap provided here: LinearSegmentedColormap, which uses piecewise-linear interpolation to define colormaps, and ListedColormap, which makes a colormap from a list of colors.

trans-unit.source: Matplotlib represents dates using floating point numbers specifying the number of days since 0001-01-01 UTC, plus 1. For example, 0001-01-01, 06:00 is 1.25, not 0.25. Values < 1, i.e. dates before 0001-01-01 UTC are not supported.
trans-unit.target: Matplotlib representa fechas utilizando números de punto flotante que especifican el número de días desde 0001-01-01 UTC, más 1. Por ejemplo, 0001-01-01, 06:00 es 1,25, no 0,25. No se admiten valores <1, es decir, fechas anteriores al 0001-01-01 UTC.

trans-unit.source: Matplotlib represents dates using floating point numbers specifying the number of days since a default epoch of 1970-01-01 UTC; for example, 1970-01-01, 06:00 is the floating point number 0.25. The formatters and locators require the use of datetime.datetime objects, so only dates between year 0001 and 9999 can be represented. Microsecond precision is achievable for (approximately) 70 years on either side of the epoch, and 20 microseconds for the rest of the allowable range of dates (year 0001 to 9999). The epoch can be changed at import time via dates.set_epoch or rcParams["dates.epoch"] to other dates if necessary; see Date Precision and Epochs for a discussion.

trans-unit.source: Most of the information in this object is stored in the underlying _GlueSpec class, which is shared between multiple glue objects. (This is a memory optimization which probably doesn't matter anymore, but it's easier to stick to what TeX does.)

Most properties of a collection can be configured per-element. Therefore, Collections have "plural" versions of many of the properties of a Patch (e.g. Collection.get_paths instead of Patch.get_path). Exceptions are the zorder, hatch, pickradius, capstyle and joinstyle properties, which can only be set globally for the whole collection.

trans-unit.source: Note that TransformWrapper instances must have the same input and output dimensions during their entire lifetime, so the child transform may only be replaced with another child transform of the same dimensions.

trans-unit.source: Note that c should not be a single numeric RGB or RGBA sequence because that is indistinguishable from an array of values to be colormapped. If you want to specify the same RGB or RGBA value for all points, use a 2-D array with a single row. Otherwise, value- matching will have precedence in case of a size matching with x and y.
trans-unit.target: Tenga en cuenta que c no debe ser una secuencia RGB o RGBA numérica única porque es indistinguible de una matriz de valores a mapear por colores. Si desea especificar el mismo valor RGB o RGBA para todos los puntos, use una matriz 2-D con una sola fila. De lo contrario, la coincidencia de valores tendrá prioridad en caso de que el tamaño coincida con x e y .

trans-unit.source: Note that positions can be a 2D array, but in practice different event groups usually have different counts so that one will use a list of different-length arrays rather than a 2D array.

Note that Matplotlib's internal font manager and fontconfig use a different algorithm to lookup fonts, so the results of the same pattern may be different in Matplotlib than in other applications that use fontconfig.

trans-unit.source: Note that the shrink kwarg provides a simple way to keep a vertical colorbar, for example, from being taller than the axes of the mappable to which the colorbar is attached; but it is a manual method requiring some trial and error. Si la barra de colores es demasiado alta (o una barra de colores horizontal es demasiado ancha), utilice un valor menor de encogimiento .

trans-unit.source: Note that these are separate artists from matplotlib.axis.Axis, thus most tick-related functions in Matplotlib won't work. For example, color and markerwidth of the ax.axis["bottom"].major_ticks will follow those of Axes.xaxis unless explicitly specified.

Note that these are separate artists from Axis class of the original mpl, thus most of tick-related command in the original mpl won't work, although some effort has made to work with. For example, color and markerwidth of the ax.axis["bottom"].major_ticks will follow those of Axes.xaxis unless explicitly specified.
trans-unit.target: Nótese que estos son artistas separados de la clase Axis del mpl original,por lo que la mayoría de los comandos relacionados con tic en el mpl original no funcionarán,aunque se ha hecho algún esfuerzo para trabajar con ellos.Por ejemplo,el color y el ancho del marcador del eje ax.axis["fondo"].major_ticks seguirán los del eje Axes.x a menos que se especifique explícitamente.

trans-unit.source: On import, the FontManager singleton instance creates a list of TrueType fonts based on the font properties: name, style, variant, weight, stretch, and size. The findfont() method does a nearest neighbor search to find the font that most closely matches the specification. If no good enough match is found, a default font is returned.
trans-unit.target: Al importar, la instancia singleton de FontManager crea una lista de fuentes TrueType en función de las propiedades de la fuente: nombre, estilo, variante, peso, extensión y tamaño. El método findfont() realiza una búsqueda de vecino más cercano para encontrar la fuente que más se aproxima a la especificación. Si no se encuentra una coincidencia lo suficientemente buena, se devuelve una fuente predeterminada.

trans-unit.source: On import, the FontManager singleton instance creates a list of ttf and afm fonts and caches their FontProperties. Once the boxes have been set up, this sends them to output. Since boxes can be inside of boxes inside of boxes, the main work of Ship is done by two mutually recursive routines, hlist_out() and vlist_out(), which traverse the Hlist nodes and Vlist nodes inside of horizontal and vertical boxes. The global variables used in TeX to store state as it processes have become member variables here.
trans-unit.target: Una vez que se han configurado las cajas, esto las envía a la salida. Como las cajas pueden estar dentro de las cajas dentro de cajas, el trabajo principal de Ship se realiza mediante dos rutinas mutuamente recursivos, hlist_out() y vlist_out() , que atraviesan los Hlist nodos y Vlist nodos dentro de cajas horizontales y verticales. Las variables globales utilizadas en TeX para almacenar el estado a medida que procesa se han convertido aquí en variables miembro.

Place vertices with each mouse click, and make the selection by completing the polygon (clicking on the first vertex). Recurrence rules may generate recurrence instances with an invalid date (e.g., February 30) or nonexistent local time (e.g., 1:30 AM on a day where the local time is moved forward by an hour at 1:00 AM). Such recurrence instances MUST be ignored and MUST NOT be counted as part of the recurrence set.
trans-unit.target: Las reglas de recurrencia pueden generar instancias de recurrencia con una fecha inválida (por ejemplo,el 30 de febrero)o con una hora local inexistente (por ejemplo,la 1:30 AM en un día en el que la hora local se adelanta una hora a la 1:00 AM).Tales instancias de recurrencia DEBEN ser ignoradas y NO DEBEN ser contadas como parte del conjunto de recurrencia.
